remarks: The set of functionals having closed kernels is closed under vector (functional) addition.  Lemmas ~ lclkrlem2a through ~ lclkrlem2y are used for the proof.  Here we express ~ lclkrlem2y in terms of membership in the set ` C ` of functionals with closed kernels.  (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lclkrlem2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lclkrlem2.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrlem2.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrlem2.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` D ) $.
lclkrlem2.c $e |- C = { f e. F | ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` f ) ) ) = ( L ` f ) } $.
lclkrlem2.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lclkrlem2.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. C ) $.
lclkrlem2.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. C ) $.
lclkrlem2 $p |- ( ph -> ( E .+ G ) e. C ) $.
$d .+ f $.
$d ._|_ f $.
$d E f $.
$d F f $.
$d G f $.
$d L f $.
